This place has been recommended to us a couple of times. We finally tried it today. Will definitely be back. It is a hidden treasure. We had a simple sausage pizza. The dough was perfect. The sauce amazing. We are coming back to sample other items on the menu.

Stopped in for lunch.

This place is Italian.  It's a cozy deli, store and restaurant all rolled into one.

Family owned by the looks of it.  Very popular.  There are tables and booths.

Ordered a Italian sub, ice-t, and fries.

All very good, and worth visiting again to select from their tasty menu.

Check it out

MMM this was wicked and delicious. Such an interesting restaurant, being a restaurant/food shop combo. You can get deli meat, pre-made braciole, cannolis, and so many other items to take home, or you can order off their very long and expansive menu. I got a dish that had broccoli, sausage, chicken, all cooked in olive oil. Can't remember its name, but it was amazing. I had a bite of a friend's broasted chicken, and it was cooked to perfection. Huge portions, just like any good Italian restaurant.

Not real sure what all the fuss is about their Broasted chicken which is actually fried chicken plus something else,  We got the 4 piece meal to go.  The broasted potatoes were boring fried potatoes.  The cole slaw has garlic it in and actually made me throw up which of course is not a good sign.  The chicken I expected juicy mouth watering juicy, which I did not get. it was dry, dry dry. The chicken is better at Costco and way less expensive.  I had to put apple sauce on my chicken to make it moist.  I would tell Guido to stick to one thing which you do good and avoid all the rest as they also sell very high priced pasta dishes, which I have not tried as they are very high priced even for Scottsdale.  The chicken dinner was also suppose to come with bread and butter and it did not it came with very dried out garlic bread.  If they had been honest and said it comes with garlic bread I would have asked for just bread and butter as I do not like garlic bread.
Nom nom nom what else can I say simply the best place to eat Italian food!!! Love this place and don't miss out on the best chocolate brownies ever!!!

This is a great hole on the wall.   I adore places like this that have great food, service and a nice atmosphere- it's a little store and restaurant. 

I had one of their great pastas and my wife had the chicken parmigiana. Both were lovely with a nice salad and table bread.   

It's one of those throw back places that serves southern Italian classics.  So don't go expecting something else and you won't be disappointed

Guido's looks like a classic italian deli to me, and a good one.  Disclaimer:  I am no expert, not being italian or ever frequented an italian neighborhood.  That being said, I sure would like to.  

Meatballz was closed again and we all needed our fix.  Guido's hit the spot with their italian beef sandwich that was cheesey, juicy and on some of the best crusty roll I've had in a while.  On the downside, the beef was pretty tough, so I'll probably have to go back to test it out again.  Spaghetti and meatballs had a well made gravy and meatballs that looked pretty good, and my son said were good, but he wouldn't even let me have a tiny taste.  Never seen him mop up sauce with garlic bread before, but he took it up like a pro.

They sell fresh pasta, pre-made entrees and salads, meats, italian ice and spumoni and the sought out San Marzano tomatoes.  The inventory is presented really well - not a speck of dust to be found on any can or shelf, fresh looking, well stocked and orderly.

Guido's has the potential for five stars if everything tastes as good as it looks.  Looks like a few more visits are in order.

Love this place! Service and food were outstanding! 
Can't wait to return! 
Hidden gem!!

Wow I was just passing through town and this little deli looked like a good place to grab a bite to eat. 

Looks can be deceiving because when i got inside this was basically a full-service restaurant, deli, and then some. 

Food took a while to come out but it was a busy night and I could see that they really cook everything homestyle and to order. It was definitely worth the wait.

I ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich which was hot and delicious, the sauce and uality of the food gives me confidence to come back and sample the whole menu.
Enjoyable little place. Great sandwiches, salads, and good selection of Italian groceries.
Second visit to Guido's. Excellent broasted chicken! Actually too much food! Our server Kendra was very personable and very attentive. She's great! Worth the 2.5 hour one-way trip to Guido's!

I've had Guido's bookmarked forever. It just so happened that I was talking with a friend of mine and Guido's came up. So what do I do, go home get my wife and we're off to Guido's. 

It's an unassuming Italian deli and restaurant. We walk in and not sure what to do cause there's no hostess but one of the servers just tell us to find a table. Cool. They basically have two server handling all the tables inside and outside. 

Took a little while but our server came and brought us our drinks. I ordered the Italian combo which is Italian Beef with homemade sausage and grilled onions and peppers with melted mozzarella. This was really good. They give you a cup of sauce to make it even more moist. The bread is fresh too. So good. The more sauce I put on the more I loved it. So good. My wife want to try my sandwich and she couldn't put it down. She loved it too. 

My wife ordered her usual the meatball sandwich which happens to be one of my favorites too. Huge meatballs with Marinera sauce with melted mozzarella. I knew I could share with her and boy was it good. Meatballs were really good and loved the sauce. My wife was raving about the bun. So fresh and soft. We both really liked it a lot. 

I decided to get a half an order of boasted fries. These were fresh and really good. I know I'm not supposed to eat a lot but so dang good. Not crispy but just right. No complaints here

So this place has an Italian deli with Italian dessert in the freezer too plus a restaurant. Very busy. Very open and reminds me a lot of DeFalco's but less cramped. Very relaxed atmosphere were you can enjoy your Italian meal. The food is spot on. Excellent. The service is pretty good. It's just not one of those place you want to rush to get in and out in a hurry. Enjoy the food. Enjoy the atmosphere. It's really good. 

The question is will I be back. Of course I will. My wife even asked me what days they are open and I know she loves it too. Can't wait to try more. I just love Italian food
Love this place! Great service, Italian food like it's suppose to be made, deli items to purchase, and specialty items any good Italian would appreciate!
This is the best deli around. For starters, they serve Boars Head. I love this place for lunch and dinner. I would recommend the Minestrone soup,chicken parmesan and fries as they are heavenly!!

This place is pretty good. I had the fried chicken dinner. Although it was very, very dry and I'll probably never get it again, I did see items in the menu that I would love to get my hands on. In the future when I go back (because I do plan to go back) I'll be able to give this spot another review and hopefully I'll be able to bring those stars a bit higher. I probably would have given this place at least 4 stars had my chicken not had the texture of rubber. It was so dried out that I thought I just bit into a piece of chicken jerky. So for now I'll leave my review as it is until I revisit. I will add this, the customer service was great! Our waitress was awesome with a great sense of humor, something I definitely look forward to on my next visit.

Coming from the NJ/NY area I was pretty skeptical about a deli in a strip mall but this place really came through. It reminded me of a pizza place back home that hasn't been updated since the 90s but doesn't matter since the food is on point. I got the italian sandwich, would've liked more meat but it was good. I will definitely become a regular here. 

Oh, and if you complained about the service, did you really expect 5 star service at a deli? Get off your "foodie" high horse.
Great customer service, well prepared and incredibly tasty food!

One of my favorite places to grab lunch or dinner in Scottsdale. Really cool environment and a cool family ran restaurant. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. It's all really good, I've tried it all.
Great food and service. Nice quaint family dining atmosphere. Generous portions of food.

Worst experience! We have been to this restaurant a few times and while we love the food and atmosphere, the lack of customer service and class that the owner/manager showed to us tonight was absolutely inexcusable. After we ordered our food, the waitress told us that their credit card machine was down but that it should be fixed soon. After we ate our meal, we were presented with the check without a word about the machine. We figured it got fixed. When the waitress brought our credit card back to our table she said that the machine was still down. She told us we had to leave the restaurant and find an ATM that we could use, then come back to pay cash. I told her that I really didn't want to have to do that, considering we had a small child with us. I offered to pay by check. She checked with the owner/manager and he said no. She apologized to us and said that she would have taken the check if it were up to her. All of a sudden the owner/manager comes to our table and starts yelling about the situation. He said that he was "stuck" and that there was nothing he could do about it. I offered again to pay by check but he told me that there was "no way" he could take that. I said "so you will run the risk of all these people leaving to go get money instead of offering an alternative way to pay, such as a check?" Then he started blabbering about God or something like that. I also told him that we will get charged a fee to pull out of the nearest ATM, then he said "well how much can that fee be? Here take a couple bucks off the bill" I said "forget it, don't bother" He was throwing his arms up in the air and he was very loud, which was completely embarrassing to us. This was a Saturday night around 7pm, and it was very crowded. My small child saw that the man was yelling at me so she started crying, saying "mommy!" We could have made an even bigger scene since we did nothing wrong and were being treated so poorly, but we chose the high road. Needless to say, we left to find cash and brought it back. We will never return there again and I will be sharing this experience with our friends and family. So disappointing.

An authentic family-run deli experience. The Italian Sausage is out of this world - get it with a side of beef juice to dip it in. This is an Italian grocery store, a meat market, and a deli all in one. Do yourself a favor and give Guido's a try soon. Very casual atmosphere with a few booths if you choose to dine in.

Been coming to Guido's since we moved to Scottsdale in 1997.  Back then there was much more family running the place.  The only 2 people I recognize now are the cook (always the same dude) and Guido.

Of all the reviews I read on Guido's (I didn't read them all, admittedly), I'm shocked more people didn't try the Broasted Chicken.  Not "fried" chicken, but a close cousin and absolutely terrific.  Juicy, crispy and darn good.  Comes with 3 huge Broasted potato wedges and cold slaw.  Let's talk about the cold slaw:  BEST in the state.  Has some kind of oniony taste that just knocks it out of the park.  Sounds strange, but sometimes I crave the cold slaw more than the chicken!
 
Wings are solid.  Pizza's OK (I'm from Brooklyn and a huge pizza snob, so nothing in AZ is going to work for me).  Hot Sandwiches are great.  Chicken Parm and Meatball sub are favorites of my teenage sons.  Great selection of beverages.  Interesting beer choices from the help-yourself-refridgerator in the front.

Prices are decent.  Service is spotty, but the kitchen is right in front of you and very open so if things aren't going well, you can walk right up to the cook and tell him.  Also, Guido is always there, so...

Only real disappointment are the frozen "Italian Ices" that sit in a freezer near the front of the place.  They are pre-packaged and frozen.  Tempting to look at, but a poor immitation of the real thing. 

If you're headed to the Harkins Shea 14 movie heater or the Big League Dugout for your baseball gear stop in.  With the lack of good Italian places in AZ, this one's worth checking out.

Most people probably come to Guidos for sandwiches, pasta and great meats but I've found their Seafood salad. It is really chock full of shrimp, mussels, squid , crab and crisp lettuce etc. the dressing is great Italian oil n vinegar . This is my choice for a wonderful lunch! It comes with hot seasoned bread too.

I had the italian combo sandwich and it was delicious. Also the French fries were made from fresh potatoes and were great. As for the gentleman who stated they needed more salt, that's what a salt shaker is for. Personally I thought they were perfect. The only negative I can say was the slice of pizza we had was real doughy and not very good. Overall food and atmosphere was very good.

I love this place! It is an really cool old school Italian deli with the kinds of things my grandparents would have just loved- lots of imported groceries, gardineria, sweets and deli meats. 

My absolute favorites are the Italian roast beef (great sub rolls!) and you must get the fresh mozzarella appetizer- half moons of crispy fried mozzarella served with marinara.

Great food almost as good as eating in Rome. Really great eggplant parmigean. Good veal parm, too. Decent bread and a truly acceptable salad. BUT, the service sucked. Forget the slowness, but ignoring? And picking up dirty napkins and silverware and then serving food without washing. That's seriously wrong. Still, good food and large servings make this a place worth revisiting.

Love this spot!  Grew up nearby and never checked it out until I was much older and no longer lived nearby, wish I would have known about it sooner because I've been missing out! Guidos gives you the genuine Italian deli feel you wouldn't expect in AZ and their top notch Italian eats transport you.  Haven't had a chance to try everything on the menu, but what I can say is everything I have had is perfection!  The servings are large and the prices are fair.  Also, don't forget dessert, they have some genuine Spumoni and decadent cannolis that'll have you rolling out the door.  Bon appetit!

Clean, neat, friendly and GOOD. Definitely a bias toward Chicago style sandwiches, pizza and Italian dishes. Had the Chicago roast beef sandwich with sausage and peppers, and au jus. Au hell - tasty! Will be back.

This place is located along a grocery store strip mall. It's a little hard to find because it's tucked in on the inside corner. That doesn't seem to deter people though. This place has been busy serving customers for the past 28 years. I had no idea they'd been there that long. Geesh, they must be doing something right. 

I've only tried a couple of things. By far, my favorite is their Italian sub. It's a freshly baked submarine roll absolutely stuffed with deli meats (salami and mortadella, pepperoni) and provolone cheese, then lettuce, tomato, onion, with a generous amount of Italian dressing poured over it. I know I should only order the half portion, but sometimes I just gotta go for the whole. Roll up your sleeves and get the napkins ready. You're in for a fantastic, messy, tasty treat.

My husband and I came for takeout after seeing Guidos on Check Please Arizona.  Cute little place.  We placed our order and somehow it never got to the chef/cook.  After waiting at least 45 minutes and several attempts by the manager to resubmit our order, we finally received our order (without any apology).  Customer service not so great!

I ordered the veal parmesan...nothing special, and the same for my husband's Bolognese.  We will not be back.  There are so many great restaurants in Scottsdale that care about their customers.
What kind of place puts up a banner with a special deal and then won't honor it? False advertising at its best. See the photo I posted with the beer and pizza special.

If it were not for yelp I would never have found this place. Tucked away in the back corner of a massive commercial complex its easy to miss; I actually had a hard time locating it. As I approached the front door I was greeted with a hand written note indicating the card machine was down and they were only accepting cash - but that didn't deter me. Came with two buddies and we decided to get a table close to the deli case which allowed for some good people watching and really helped to soak in the ambiance. It has the Italian deli feel to it; you know...the one with friendly people, all kinds of products you can't get at the grocery store, the finest quality cold cuts and cheese, homemade bread, and freezers packed with ice cream and pastas. We all opted for sandwiches; and the full size. Holy smokes were they massive and to be honest us full grown men could have gotten by on half a sandwich each. I chose the meatball marinara as I think it's a good way to judge a place - you get a feel for their sauce and the meat they use. The sauce was just a tiny bit on the sweet side for me but I have to say it's one of the best I have ever had. Meatballs were juicy and of quality ingredients. Both the sauce and meatballs were simply yet super complex in terms of taste. The bread was soft and light on the inside but crispy on the outside - truly a work of art. Topped off with some provolone cheese and a side of sauce for dipping was the finishing touches of a masterpiece. Great people, even better food...what else could you ask for. I will be back.

Excellent authentic Italian food made from scratch.  We always enjoy the friendly atmosphere created by the staff.  Love the spaghetti & meatballs!  Be sure to finish your meal with spumoni direct from Italy!
Love this place.  The breasted chicken is the best.  The servers are always friendly.  Makes for an easy dinner during the week.

My hubby met me here for lunch and it was crazy delicious. I've come to this location since 2006 and love everything on the menu. The only reason why I am taking a star away is that it took over 30 minutes just for us to get our lunch. My hubby ordered a calzone and I did the shrimp and marinara appetizer. I felt so bad that he had to quickly rush out the moment his lunch arrived and did not have time to sit down and enjoy it. Aside from the long wait, their food is truly delicious. We will be giving this spot one quick try for lunch again.

Wow !!!  What a joke.  We ordered for the first time from this place based on Yelp reviews...Never again.  The food looks great, but they didn't give us anything to eat it with.  When I called, the guy hardly spoke English and told me you have to pay extra for forks.  Are you serious ????  What horrible service.

Picked up sandwiches from Guido's Deli one night. Although I wasn't with my husband when he picked up the order, he commented on how good the service was. I had the Italian Sub with Capocollo, Mortadella and Salami. It was a good sandwich...huge and loaded with meat! I couldn't finish it. Everyone in our group enjoyed their sandwich as well, but they were so big that we all ended up having leftovers for lunch the following day. We also ordered cannolis and although they were small, they were awesome!! Sweet, but not too sweet, with a delicious filling and mini chocolate chips. I love cannolis!

Okay place. Was better back in the day. Itallian deli, store restaurant. Food was descent... service and friendliness not so great. Expensive for mediocre service. They were better back in the day when cared about being the best at food and friendly  service..not so much now...sad, not a go to place anymore.

Worst service ever over a half an hour to even order. If you come here get it to go! The food itself is good but they always seem to mess up our orders I really cant give more than 3 stars. Also wish their meatballs were all beef, but their sauce and sandwiches are amazing.
Everything is amazing!  Guido makes the world's best sandwich. They are all great but ask for a lemon pepper chicken with hot peppers.

We have had really good luck here....Scottsdale is awash with this sort of fare, mostly boring, but this one works..... not really cheap but we feel the food is well worth it.  the owner is   very experienced and has a really super crew in the kitchen.....I don't think your going to do any better around here or for that matter pretty much anywhere else....He really watches the quality....give it a shot!!!!!!!!!!!!

When I first saw this place I actually called my boyfriend to ask: "Is this it?!" For a strip mall restaurant that doesn't look like much from the outside this place is surprisingly delightful on the inside. The walls are covered with fun decor and newspaper articles while any available surface space offers baked goods, t-shirts, cookies, and snacks. The best part about this place was the server. Robbie was no doubt the most pleasant server I've had in YEARS and I eat out all the time. He accommodated several special requests and was friendly & funny without being over-the-top or annoying. He didn't even seem irritated when my boyfriend and I started spatting across the table. Seriously Robbie, I would open a restaurant myself just to hire you. I guess I should also mention that the food was great! I will definitely be back the next time my boyfriend and I feel like fighting over some good food.

Went there tonight for dinner and will NEVER  go back! The owner is rude. His computer system was down tonight and made this everyones problem but his own. He told his customers to go to a bank/atm and then come back and pay their bill. I don't have an atm card, so now what??  He was loud and overbearing to customers. His loss, will not return..
Great family owned place to eat AND take out -  try the meatballs. They are heavenly!
Great food, great prices. Dine in or get take out. Always consistent. We love this place. There are also healthy options.
This place is a great authentic Chicago style deli but also serves hot pastas as well as many other treats. Has been here for a very long time and if you go in you will find out why.
Outstanding neighborhood deli and dining. Friendly and attentive service with great food priced right. Try it and you'll add it to your list of favorites.
One of the best meals I've had in a long time with great prices!  I had the calamari and Howie's Pastrami Sandwich.  Both were incredible! I highly recommend it.

Introduced our family to Guidos last night for my husbands birthday. We've been to Guidos MANY times and have noticed the last several times we have not been happy with the food and especially the service. Each time we've gone there are new servers which explains, but certainly doesn't not excuse,  the bad service. My husband had the veal piccata which he said was burned and not tender, and the pasta side was not cooked and the sauce was bland. My daughter had the linguine with shrimp and was disappointed the shrimp was not grilled, but deep fried (this should be noted in the description). Sadly we will probably not waste our time driving an hour for this restaurant.
We had a great dinner at Guido's.  the pasta was homemade, the prices reasonable, and the food very flavorful.  All of this in a deli market setting.  Two thumbs up.

If you love mayonnaise, this is your kind of place.  Ordered the chicken salad sandwich to-go, first of all, they didn't ask what size I wanted and they gave me a foot-long (way too big), then, there was so much mayonnaise on it that it was inedible.  So, $14 for a sandwich that I couldn't choke down. Besides the mayonnaise, not much flavor.  Never going back! Prices for sandwiches are ridiculous.
